parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
A teacher, master. From didasko; an instructor.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and lambano; to take eagerly, i.e. Seize, possess, etc.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
In the very act. From epi and autos and a derivative of phor; in theft itself, i.e. in actual crime.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To commit adultery (of a man with a married woman, but also of a married man). From moichos; to commit adultery.
